did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Beracha ve Shalom at Joden Savanna - Suriname collection.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Photographs and printed material relating to the synagogue.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Photographs and printed material relating to the synagogue, published in Paramaribo, Surinam.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Beracha ve Shalom at Joden Savanna - Suriname collection, #8492m, Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Documents
Description of the “Restoration of Jewish Savannah”
Article from “De West Van Woensdag” (9 Maart 1966) titled “Restauratie van Joden Savanna, Hof van Justitie en Huis van Bewaring” (“Restoration of the Jewish Savanah…”)
Paper in Hebrew which appears to be about the synagogue
“Plan to reconstruct the Synagogue Beracha ve Shalom at Joden Savanna – Suriname” booklet

scopecontent.p:
Contents:
1. Illustration of the elevation by direction
2. Breakdown of each section of the synagogue, focus on the outside
3. Breakdown of the synagogue’s interior
4. Plan of the synagogue, cemetery marked
5. Location of the synagogue in relation to the Suriname River
6. Estimate of the Reconstruction of the synagogue “Beracha ve Shalon” at Joden Savanna
7. Photos – 1U copy 2 “remainder, North-elevation”; 1Y copy 2 “remainder, West-elevation”; 1Z copy 2 “detail of a tomb-stone”; four photos showing the details of a tombstone with Hebrew writing, two winged children, a skull and crossbones, and other imagery

did.unittitle: Photographs

“Gezicht op de Joden Savanne“ – Naar een teekening uit den atlas behoorende bij het werk van M. D. Teenstra „De Landbouw in de kolonie Suriname“, 1835 (– “View of the Jewish Savannah,“ taken from the work of M. D. Teenstra, “Agriculture in the colony of Suriname“); shows two houses on a hill, one figure seated on a log
“Paramaribo“, Augusta Currel; illustration of the capital of Suriname, flat boats with two figures each, houses on hills in the distance
“De Joden-Savanne“ (“The Jewish-Savannah“); “Synagogue“ written in the corner, illustrartion with two boats, small houses and figures on the shore
unlabeled; uneven field with stakes driven into the ground leading to a house in the distance, trees (including palm trees) breach the horizon
unlabeled; three boats, each with figures, one with two sails, the others with oars; several hills with houses, some on stilts.
unlabeled; two figures gazing at another figure gesturing toward a child; an overhang of wood and some foliage is nestled among rocky slopes, trees behind.
“View of the Settlement called the Jews‘ Savannah“; two figures conversing in shadow, one seated, one reclining; behind are boats on a river and houses on a hill
Three figures, two reclining and one holding spears;, beside a tree; a house to their left; other houses and a review before
“Begraafplaats, Joden-Savanne-Suriname“ “( “Cemetary, Jewish-Savannah-Suriname“); a map of the cemetary marking graves; several graves have their iconography illustrated
“Post Gelderland en Joden Savannah“ (“Gelderland [Province] in the Jewish Savannah“); appears to be a more detailed version of 1B

“Joden Savannah“ – Gezigt op de Sunagoge en Kerkhof Van de Zude van het Militair Cordonpad Gezien (“Jewish-Savannah“- Sight of the synogague and graveyard...); appears to be a more detailed version of 1D
